title: Official "trade roles" system
body:
Not sure why this isn't out yet, but there needs to be a way to officially trade roles with someone in champ select, like the trade champions button. This will change the role under the summoner name to what they're going to play. It would avoid confusion in champ select from people just saying in chat what role they are.

Now that I think about it more, this could make catching people who don't go their role a whole lot easier, if you were to report someone for such a thing. It would also make a definitive answer for if you ask someone to swap roles and they don't say anything until late.

replies.body: It would also add a system for players who give up their roles to take support and get auto fill protection.
I  had jungle locked in and I didn't have autofill protection but our support wanted jungle and asked so I went support and guess what after game I had autofill protection as if I locked in support

My friend and I were talking about this a few days ago actually. If I swap roles with someone to some sort of autofilled role I should receive autofill protection for being the "nice guy" and technically getting filled to support  (put 2 other roles and got support in the end). The main reason I don't swap with people who get autofilled is A) no one usually does it to me and I can't get mid lane to save my life anyway and B) there is a fairly high chance I could get autofilled to support the next game and have to play it twice in a row.

I don't necessarily hate playing support, but there is a reason I don't put it in my role selection. If everyone gets a role they tolerate and i can control the 1 out of maybe 10 games I HAVE to play support (I take the role here willingly with a team I can hope will do better than if I intentionally queue support) then it seems like a win-win.

a QoL improvement that would make players feel a little bit better

except for the autofilled to support player.  He would be just as cranky as he was before.  No rest for the wicked.
How, exactly, does this matter?

This would just avoid confusion with people, since now the only way to tell which role someone is going is to ask in chat, which may or may not give you the answer you need. Plus, it would alert those that are involved in the trade so that they could give a definitive answer.
Also people won't be scared, should you be premade and not make the discussion in public chat, that you want to go "Botlane Marksman" Soraka, when you just swapped role. Clarity.
I would want two buttons, though.  One that says "will you trade with me?" and another that announces "I'm _willing_ to trade if anyone got autofilled."
Or, even better: Have an option before you queue up to take the spot of anyone that was autofilled, if they share the role you got. I certainly wouldn't mind this because I can play all roles well
I feel like a simple announcement in chat would work better for the second idea, but the first button idea is what I'm trying to get at with this idea. Neat idea though!

I love the idea but I don't think Riot would punish based on it (aka make you do it if you change roles).  It'd be great to add in checks to remind the jungler "btw you no got {{summoner:11}} just a heads up bb"
Exactly. This way, if Riot implements the pop-up warning for "Yo jungler boi, you dun got no smite ya dumbass" that so many people have asked for, it'll always reach the right person.

> "Yo jungler boi, you dun got no smite ya dumbass" 

They need to use this exact wording if they ever implement a smite warning.

I personally would love a reminder or notification that someone would like to switch roles with me.  instead of feeling like a jack ass for locking in and realizing in the middle of all the chat chatter someone asked if they could switch.  it would also help with the autofill problems and allow more team work communication before the game even starts.{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
Yes yes exactly, that's the point!! Thank you :)

I have been saying this for a while now!!! EVERYONE PLEASE UPVOTE OP's POST

One of my main reasons - Most people have 1 or 2 primary roles. These same people aren't upset when they get a role that is not their primary role, even though they completely suck at the lane they got filled with. They say, Oh well, I've been playing league for 3 years now, I can play any role,  and play it out. They also don't chat much. They suck super bad at the lane they got filled at, further contributing to your frustration and loss.. Now I haven't taken any polls to ensure the accuracy of this, but as a support main, I can tell when someone gets AUTOFILLED as an ADC. Their mechanics, bad ADC mechanics in general, are super obvious by about 2 minutes in. This isn't going to prevent that all the time, but it could help. 

"XXXX Would like to change positions with you. YES / NO"
It would be cool if they did that and then mixed in the honour system so whenever you switch roles with somebody you get a teamwork honour.
We need to fund this
Not enough IP to buy support role... cant trade gg
**Cool idea.**
Thanks :)))

I really don't want to get spammed with trade requests every game. Which is absolutely what would happen in solo q. It's very common for someone to be upset they get support.  

There are certainly some benefits to be had with it but they're pretty minor.

There would definitely be a limit to how many times someone could request to trade with you, just like with trading champions. But still, I get spammed more frequently to swap roles now with the current system than I think anyone ever would with a system like this.

As said above, getting autofill protection for trading roles with someone who got autofilled would at least incentivize considering trading roles with someone who got autofilled. If you don't want to play support or whatever you can always just ignore them and go on through champion select, but if you really don't care about playing support this one game and get protected for the next 2+ you'd be in a better spot than leaving the autofill on support and end up picking the classic full AP lux with no sightstone.
